page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW - EGMERE AREA
page.content: The region is predominantly{agricult- {ural}with four farms: one of 850 acres, one of 650 acres, one of 720 acres. The other, partly in the area, amounts to 700 acres. The soil is mainly light and stony - suitable for any cereal or root crop. All of the land is under Estate ownership. About a third is owned by the Wals- ingham Estate Co.(Mr John Gurney) and the rest by The Holkham Estate Co. (Lord Leicester). The farms are tenanted properties and most dwellings are tied cottages. It is sparsely populated. There are a few patches of woodland that are worked. In addition the area is used for game breeding and shooting. The landscape is gentle and undulating nature with good cover for a wide range of flora and fauna. Places of historical value are a 'lost' village and a wartime airfield.
